content.text:
# List of wars involving Taiwan

This is a list of wars involving Taiwan.
Taiwan has been ruled by various regimes throughout its history.
Wars involving Taiwan
:
:
:
:

|-

|style="background:#AF9"| Chinese victory
* China recovers territories lost to Japan since the Treaty of Shimonoseki
|-
! style="background:#0000CD" colspan="4"| Republic of China (1945–present)
|-
|style="background:#efefef"| Chinese Civil War(second phase)(1945–1949)
|style="background:#efefef"| 1945–1949: Republic of China
* Kuomintang
* Republic of China Armed Forces
|style="background:#efefef"| 1945–1949: Yan'an Soviet (1949)
*  Chinese Communist Party
*  People's Liberation Army
|style="background:#F88" | Communist victory
* Communist control of mainland China
* Proclamation of the People's Republic of China
* Retreat of the government of the Republic of China to Taiwan
|-
|style="background:#efefef"| First Taiwan Strait Crisis(1954–1955)
|style="background:#efefef"|
|style="background:#efefef"|
|style="background:#ACF"| Ceasefire; major escalation avoided
* The PRC takes control of the Yijiangshan and Dachen Islands
* The ROC and US navies evacuate military personnel and civilians from the Dachen Islands
* Formosa Resolution of 1955 and Sino-American Mutual Defense Treaty between the ROC and US
|-
|style="background:#efefef"| Second Taiwan Strait Crisis(1958)
|style="background:#efefef"|
|style="background:#efefef"|
|style="background:#ACF"| Ceasefire
* Successful military defence of Kinmen by the ROC
* Status quo ante bellum
|-
|style="background:#efefef"| Communist insurgency in Thailand(1965–1983)
|style="background:#efefef"|
*
*  Royal Thai Police
*  Border Patrol Police
*  Volunteer Defense Corps
*  Thahan Phran
* Internal Security Operations Command
* Village Scouts
* Nawaphon
* Red Gaurs
Kingdom of Laos (until 1975)  ROC 93rd Division
Supported by: Shan United Revolutionary Army Karen National Union
|style="background:#efefef"|  Communist Party of Thailand
* People's Liberation Army of Thailand
* Federation of Farmers and Workers
* National Student Center of Thailand
* Ethnic groups, especially the Hmong
Pathet Lao Malayan Communist Party Communist Party of BurmaSupported by:
Khmer Rouge (until 1978) People's Republic of Kampuchea (since 1979) People's Republic of China (until 1980) North Vietnam
|style="background:#ACF"| Thai government victory
* Amnesty declared on 23 April 1980 by the Thai government
* Order 66/2523 signed by Prime Minister Prem Tinsulanonda
* Communist insurgency declines and ends in 1983
|-
